name: 3-Tier SaaS Pricing Table with Monthly/Yearly Toggle
description: A responsive 3-tier pricing table component with monthly/yearly billing toggle, highlighted 'Most Popular' plan, and feature comparison. Perfect for SaaS marketing pages, product pages, and subscription-based services.

aiAgentInstructions.summary: Implement a responsive 3-tier pricing table with billing frequency toggle. The table should display three plans (Starter, Professional highlighted as 'Most Popular', and Enterprise) with pricing that updates based on monthly/yearly selection. Adapt to the user's framework and styling system.
keyFeatures: Billing frequency toggle (monthly/yearly) with visual feedback and savings indicator
Three plan cards with clear visual hierarchy and 'Most Popular' badge
Smooth price change animations when billing frequency switches
Feature lists with checkmarks for included features and x-marks for unavailable
Prominent CTA buttons (primary for highlighted plan, secondary for others)
Responsive grid layout (3 columns desktop, stacked mobile)
Full keyboard accessibility with ARIA labels and focus management
CRITICAL: Styling MUST match the project's existing conventions. Detect framework and styling system first, then use ONLY that system. Do NOT introduce new styling systems.
CRITICAL: When detecting vanilla CSS, ALWAYS create CSS classes in a stylesheet. NEVER use inline style attributes on HTML elements.
CRITICAL: When detecting React, extract logic into separate custom hooks that do ONE thing each.
implementationSteps: 0. CRITICAL: Detect the project's framework and styling system BEFORE writing any code. Examine package.json, existing component files, config files, and style imports. Use ONLY the detected system.
1. Create pricing data structure with plans, features, and pricing tiers
2. Implement billing frequency state (monthly/yearly) with toggle component
3. Build three plan cards with header, pricing, CTA, and feature list
4. Implement price calculation based on billing frequency
5. Add smooth price change animations with stagger effect
6. Style 'Most Popular' plan with visual distinction (badge, shadow, scale)
7. Implement responsive grid layout (3-col desktop → 1-col mobile)
8. Add keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes for accessibility
10. Use ONLY the detected styling system. Match existing component patterns exactly.

react.stateManagement: useState for billingFrequency, useMemo for computed prices
react.example: const [billingFrequency, setBillingFrequency] = useState('monthly'); const currentPrice = useMemo(() => billingFrequency === 'monthly' ? plan.monthlyPrice : plan.yearlyPrice, [billingFrequency, plan]);
react.customHooks: Optional: usePricing(billingFrequency) hook to encapsulate pricing logic
react.animation: Use CSS transitions or react-spring for price changes

vue.stateManagement: ref() for billingFrequency, computed() for current prices
vue.example: const billingFrequency = ref('monthly'); const currentPrice = computed(() => billingFrequency.value === 'monthly' ? plan.monthlyPrice : plan.yearlyPrice);
vue.animation: Use transition component or CSS transitions

angular.stateManagement: Component properties for billingFrequency, getter methods for computed values
angular.example: billingFrequency: 'monthly' | 'yearly' = 'monthly'; getCurrentPrice(plan: Plan) { return this.billingFrequency === 'monthly' ? plan.monthlyPrice : plan.yearlyPrice; }

svelte.stateManagement: let billingFrequency = 'monthly'; reactive statements for computed values
svelte.example: let billingFrequency = 'monthly'; $: currentPrice = billingFrequency === 'monthly' ? plan.monthlyPrice : plan.yearlyPrice;

aiImplementationPrompt: Create a responsive 3-tier SaaS pricing table with billing frequency toggle (monthly/yearly). Display three plans: Starter ($9/mo, $89/yr), Professional ($29/mo, $279/yr, highlighted as 'Most Popular'), and Enterprise ($99/mo, $990/yr). Each plan card should include a name, description, animated pricing that updates smoothly when billing changes, a prominent CTA button (primary for Professional, secondary for others), and a feature list with checkmarks and x-marks. Use a CSS Grid layout (3 columns desktop, 1 column mobile with 24px gap). Implement smooth animations for price changes (250ms fade/slide with optional 50ms stagger) and card hover effects. Ensure keyboard accessibility with ARIA labels, focus indicators, and proper tab order. Respect prefers-reduced-motion. The billing toggle should be a switch with savings badge ('Save 20%' for yearly). Adapt to {{USER_FRAMEWORK}} with {{USER_STYLING_LIBRARY}}, using ONLY existing project conventions. CRITICAL: If vanilla CSS, create CSS classes, never inline styles. If React, use separate custom hooks for concerns.
